events.originalText: A group of Taliban gunmen attacked the Inter-Continental Hotel in Kabul, Afghanistan, sparking a 12-hour battle that left at least 21 people dead.
events.subtitle: Taliban
events.headline: Taliban gunmen attack Inter-Continental Hotel in Kabul, Afghanistan, leaving 21 dead

events.originalText: In Washington, D.C., Barack Obama was inaugurated (pictured) as the first African American president of the United States.
events.subtitle: First inauguration of Barack Obama
events.headline: Barack Obama inaugurated as first African American president of the United States

events.originalText: During a national financial crisis, thousands of people protested (pictured) at the Icelandic parliament in Reykjavík.
events.subtitle: 2008–2011 Icelandic financial crisis
events.headline: Thousands protest at Icelandic parliament during national financial crisis

events.originalText: Air Inter Flight 148 crashed into the Vosges while circling to land at Strasbourg Airport, France, resulting in 87 deaths.
events.subtitle: Air Inter Flight 148
events.headline: Air Inter Flight 148 crashes in France, 87 dead

events.originalText: The Soviet Red Army violently cracked down on Azeri pro-independence demonstrations in Baku, Azerbaijan SSR.
events.subtitle: Red Army
events.headline: Soviet Red Army cracks down on Azeri pro-independence demonstrations in Baku

events.originalText: Bengali student activist Amanullah Asaduzzaman was shot and killed by East Pakistani police, an event that led to the Bangladesh Liberation War.
events.subtitle: Amanullah Asaduzzaman
events.headline: Bengali student activist shot and killed by East Pakistani police, sparking Bangladesh Liberation War

events.originalText: The Houston Cougars upset the UCLA Bruins in what became known as the "Game of the Century", ending the Bruins' 47-game winning streak, and establishing college basketball as a sports commodity on American television.
events.subtitle: Houston Cougars men's basketball
events.headline: Houston Cougars upset UCLA Bruins in 'Game of the Century'

events.originalText: World War II: Germany began the evacuation of at least 1.8 million people from East Prussia in anticipation of the advancing Soviet Red Army, an operation that took nearly two months to complete.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Germany evacuates 1.8 million people from East Prussia during World War II

events.originalText: The Holocaust: Reinhard Heydrich and other senior Nazi officials met at the Wannsee Conference near Berlin to discuss the implementation of the "Final Solution to the Jewish Question".
events.subtitle: The Holocaust
events.headline: Nazi officials meet at Wannsee Conference to discuss 'Final Solution to the Jewish Question'

events.originalText: Honório Hermeto Carneiro Leão, Marquis of Paraná, became the de facto first prime minister of the Empire of Brazil.
events.subtitle: Honório Hermeto Carneiro Leão, Marquis of Paraná
events.headline: Honório Hermeto Carneiro Leão becomes de facto first prime minister of Empire of Brazil

events.originalText: Edward Balliol, whose father John was briefly King of Scotland, gave up his claim to the throne in exchange for an English pension.
events.subtitle: Edward Balliol
events.headline: Edward Balliol gives up claim to Scottish throne for English pension

events.originalText: Simon de Montfort summoned local representatives to the Palace of Westminster to attend a parliament, considered the forerunner of the House of Commons of England.
events.subtitle: Simon de Montfort, 6th Earl of Leicester
events.headline: Simon de Montfort summons local representatives to Palace of Westminster for parliament

events.originalText: According to legend, Lalli slew Bishop Henry of Finland with an axe on the ice of Lake Köyliönjärvi in Köyliö.
events.subtitle: Lalli
events.headline: Legend of Lalli slaying Bishop Henry of Finland on Lake Köyliönjärvi
